attributes.action: Raise the age to 18 for a child's train ticket
attributes.background: I was on the train going to Lisburn, the conductor asked me what age I was, I replied "16". He then went on to say I cannot give you a child ticket as you are 16 proceeding to give me a lecture on how it is illegal to ask for a child's ticket.Yet you are still considered a 'child' till you are 18.
attributes.additional_details: How do they expect us to get the money to pay for VERY expensive train journeys when we have just left school. We have no income, as individuals need time to get a job or go into further education - this can be very costly depending on what uni/tech you would like to attend.

attributes.action: The public to decide what 10 issues they want addressing and in which priority.
attributes.background:
So in a nutshell, a system which allows the people’s top 10 issues to be listed, prioritised and given measurable performance criteria with dated milestones for interim measurement.

These issues would be updated at each new election or after coming out of the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
All parties would have same top 10 KIP's which would give consistency and allow performance to be easily measured and compared by the average person.

Currently, all the different party manifestoes are complied by themselves and can’t be easily cross-referenced. This means performance measurement is not easy for the average person.

Obviously the parties they would have all the other issues which can be prioritised and outlined in their own way.

attributes.action: We propose union between UK and Turkey to mitigate against the impacts of Brexit
attributes.background: We the undersigned, concerned about the grave economic, social and political impacts of Britain’s imminent exit from the European Union, call on parliament to debate the potential benefits of full political and economic union between the UK and Turkey.
attributes.additional_details: Since neither country has a future within the EU, we would be Better Off Together!

attributes.action: Use the EU referendum as a basis for a 2nd renegotiation of EU membership
attributes.background:
The EU referendum was a close call, only a difference of one million or so votes separated the opinions of nearly 34 million voters.

The first set of renegotiation weren't successful in the first place, thus, try again and with the added critical mass of this historical event - get a better deal.

attributes.action: Make it law for sun tan lotions to show the Uva star rating on the packaging
attributes.background: The uva star rating provides us with the broad spectrum cover that the sun cream gives us. The EU standard is 3 star but advice is given that we should be looking for a 4 or 5 star. Many brands do not publish what their rating is so the consumer can not make an informed decision when buying.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bad.org.uk/for-the-public/skin-cancer/sunscreen-fact-sheet

attributes.action: Set aside parliamentary time to debate banning petitions.
attributes.background: Petitions are becoming the bane of our existence. Hardly a day passes without some irritant imploring us to support one in a vain attempt to get the Government to do something of very little consequence instead of spending precious parliamentary time on something of significance.

attributes.action: Introduce minimum professional qualifications for marketing services in the UK.
attributes.background: Considering the damage that poor advice or deliberate mis-selling of marketing services can do to our local & regional economies, it's time minimum professional qualifications were introduced to ensure protection for SME's across the UK. Greater accountability in marketing & advertising is required.

attributes.action:
Review how the fines system works.
Using a percentage of total income.
attributes.background:
It would be a much fairer system if the system had a set percentage of total income for any fines handed out, as such the detterant isnt the same to a someone with a high income as it may be to someone on a lower income.
It also lessens the penalty if it is having no effect on the offender.
attributes.additional_details:
I feel this is pretty self explanatory, please review how the fines system is worked, it is an unfair system that currently penalises only people with smaller incomes.

Whilst not acting as a deterrent at all to high income earners.

If the system was worked off a percentage of total income then it would be much fairer to all, no matter how much money they have.
The percentage could increase the worse the crime, this may be a larger deterrent to all offenders.

attributes.action: England to have a bank holiday every 1st Monday of every month.
attributes.background: We as a nation are overworked. We do not spend enough time enjoying the little things in life with the people that matter.

attributes.action: Increase winter fuel payments and make them taxable.
attributes.background: This is a universal benefit but is not paid to pensioners living in the EU. A precedent that this benefit is not universal but is paid on the basis of need. Thus it should be either taxed or means tested. It cannot be different rules for UK pensioners who choose to live in the EU.

attributes.action: Stop birth certificate stating "Father Unknown" when the father doesn't register
attributes.background: When registering a babies birth, if the father is not in attendance, either by being unwilling or unable, the father is shown on the certificate as Unknown. I find this unacceptable as it suggests the mother is promiscuous. Please remove the word Unkown and leave blank or allow Unwilling.

attributes.action: Impose age ratings on music videos using the same system used for films.
attributes.background: Some music videos (such as Rihanna's "Better Have My Money" video) contain themes (i.e. glorified cruelty, drug use and nudity) which are inappropriate for children but have no age restrictions.
attributes.additional_details: Parents can't always stop their children from watching videos like this as it can be shown to them by school friends, and or watched on their phones and iPads. It is not always possible for parents to know, and control, what their children are watching. And these videos can be watched by children as young as primary school age. Please sign this petition and help stop this.

attributes.action: Lower the cost or remove the cost of PRS & PPL Licensing
attributes.background: Many people over the years has been paying mega amount for a piece of paper that will allow you to create an online radio station. The costs per year vary from £545 - £2000. Myself and others think it should be removed in general. Let young people run a station without the fear of getting a fine!

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law, to require the votes of MPs to be published.
attributes.background:
To stop MPs verbally stating their intention to vote one way but voting another.
Also, to highlight "tactical" voting and to give clarity to the electorate.

attributes.action: Raise tuition fees please.
attributes.background: Tuition fees are far too low and students are getting off easy. Please raise them!
attributes.additional_details: Raise them.

attributes.action: Stop motor insurers voiding innocent drivers' insurance policies
attributes.background: After a non-fault road traffic accident where my spine was injured, I received notice that my insurance was to be voided due to inadvertent (or innocent) non-disclosure of material fact.  The insurer could have checked the details for free at any time, but waited til I claimed.
attributes.additional_details:
There are multiple cases where the insurer is voiding policies after a claim is made.  My argument is that they are collecting "Golden Tickets", where they let you pay a policy until they are liable for something, so removing all risk

- They have a responsibility to check the details when it is free to do so.
- They shouldn't void insurance for trivial date mix-ups on policy, but rewrite/update instead.
- After non-fault incidents insurers shouldn't be allowed to throw the claimant to the wall.

attributes.action: Abolish the harsh new curriculum for secondary students!
attributes.background: The new secondary school curriculum is long, harsh and pointless. The amount of work and stress students put in does not equate to what students get out. The new tests take much more of students time and limits basic life skills such as team working.
attributes.additional_details: Lets bring back fairness to our education system, with your help we will!

attributes.action: Make it illegal for companies to charge late payment fees.
attributes.background: Most companies charge you today if you pay for your bill late for example Talk talk charge £10 if you don't pay on time, I think this is wrong what happens if we pay early they don't give us £10, they should be happy they have their payment.

attributes.action: Legislate that employers must publish how many professional roles are part time
attributes.background: The aim is to encourage large companies to offer more senior part time or job share work, to mirror the public sector where many such roles are available, e.g. teachers and doctors.  More transparency should help inclusion, and lead to a better gender balance at senior levels in the private sector.
attributes.additional_details:
For many women their career is over when they have a family as they want to return to their profession more flexibly but no jobs are available. The private sector needs to mirror the public sector where many opportunities are available. 
They will then be able to utilise the skills of women they have trained for much longer and this will lead to more women in senior roles.
This is timely with the new legislation regarding equal pay.
We understand that some senior roles can't be done part time.

attributes.action: Legalise DMT
attributes.background: Dimethyltryptamine (DMT) is a natural occurring molecule of the tryptamine family. When you sleep at night DMT is released in your brain producing the effect that we call “dreaming”. DMT has no known negative effects on the human body due to its natural occurrence in the brain. It is not addictive.
attributes.additional_details: It allows for an "ego" break. That is to say to leave you open to formulate new ideas and beliefs about how the user sees reality in a positive manner.  Thus I believe if done correctly in a controlled environment will help with depression, attitudes, harming beliefs, how one connects with the real world and other people, etc...

attributes.action: Investigations offered for all miscarried babies regardless of gestation.
attributes.background: Miscarrying a much loved and wanted child is heart breaking.  It is a life changing event that leaves the parents, especially the mother, with many unanswered questions.  Often guilt is felt and not knowing WHY is very damaging both psychologically and emotionally.  Testing will bring understanding
attributes.additional_details: Testing is not routinely offered unless a lady has had 3 or more miscarriages, or her loss happens in the second or third trimester.  As miscarriages happen in 1:4 pregnancies this leaves a very high percentage of women with questions and unimaginable pain.  The not knowing WHY is often the hardest to come to terms with.  Many miscarriages do have an underlying reason and for the parents who have lost their baby this is vital information that would help them.  They have the right to know WHY.

attributes.action: Have an annual referendum on the most signed petition to make it legally binding
attributes.background: In late 2006 the government set up the e-petitions website as a way for people to engage with politics. Millions of people have signed petitions, but we still don't feel like these petitions are given any real attention or importance. Petitions having the chance to become laws would change this.
attributes.additional_details:
The e-petitions website was created in November 2006 and the created petitions cover everything from tax to immigration, moral and ethical concerns, education, science and the very direction of the country. 

In 2015, the BBC reported "an unnamed government minister branded the site an own-goal thought up by a "prat"". 
People still don't feel the issues they are passionate about are taken seriously. We create and sign petitions because we want to see change, we want our voices to be heard.

attributes.action: Restrict private parking charges to reasonable amounts.
attributes.background: It is proposed that the government amend the Protection of Freedom Act 2014 to restrict the amount a private company can issue a parking charge to a fair and reasonable amount and no more than what the local council can issue a penalty notice.
attributes.additional_details:
Every day many parking charge notices are issued to vehicles parking on private land. Normally, the fee to cover the car is a reasonable nominal amount. However, for those that overstay the period the vehicle is covered or parking the car without any cover the charges are unreasonable and far more than the loss of business the proprietor suffers. 

The everyday person in the United Kingdom that uses parking facilities lawfully but from time to time cannot cover their car for entirely adequate reasons are suffering unreasonable financial burdens.

attributes.action: Have one NHS distribution centre and buying in bulk whilst making cheaper deals.
attributes.background: We need to have one NHS distribution centre sending all the medical equipment and medicines to each individual hospital. Buying in bulk,getting better and more controled deals. Stoping different hospitals paying different prices,hopefully saving millions. The NHS deserves a better deal,and so do we!

attributes.action: Stop forcing English Standard on Young Deaf children
attributes.background: Make English more accessible for Deaf People (e.g. for us not to be forced to achieve English at C grade standard) each classes should have specialist tutor (e.g. Teacher of Deaf and being taught in small groups) Deaf people should not being stopped progressing from achieving a C grade or above
attributes.additional_details: English is our second language, as we find English so hard to understand! which is why we use Sign Language which has a different structure and no written language. We need to stop feeling like we are being forced to learn English at C grade Standard and it is important that we taught English in a way that is accessible to us.

attributes.action: Introduce a plan of anti-ransomware measures
attributes.background: Ransomware computer viruses target more and more ordinary UK citizens and organizations. Viruses like described here: http://myspybot.com/odin-virus/ cause huge damages. Millions flow away into cyber criminals' pockets. We want to know what is being done to protect us.
attributes.additional_details:
Plenty of things an be done:

 - Government can strengthen cryptocurrencies related laws. For example, make Bitcoin exchange companies keep records of their users.   

- Government can cooperate with security professionals to develop decryption tools.

- Government can introduce stronger online data protection policies. Organizations should create backups of their data.

- Government can raise awareness that we should stop paying to hackers. Make paying immoral and maybe illegal.

attributes.action: If 20% of a workforce are claiming tax credits  no dividend to shareholders
attributes.background: Any Company  paying its workers so low that they are subsidizing their wages with tax credits, should be barred from paying a dividend. The taxpayer should not be propping up greedy bosses that should  be paying correct wages  to the workers not  to shareholders

attributes.action: Stop tax exiles from claiming government subsidies of any sort
attributes.background:
If anyone chooses to be a tax exile and not pay their fair share of tax to the British people then they should be excluded from the tax system completely, this  should include receiving any form of taxpayers money
If they wish to opt out of the system they should opt out completely

attributes.action: Make the UK a permanent armed neutral country like Switzerland.
attributes.background: Since Switzerland became an armed neutral power in 1815 the UK has approximately been involved in 50 conflicts and lost 1,540,462 UK military and civilian life's (20 of those conflicts and 7456 lifes have been lost since WW2).
attributes.additional_details: Becoming an armed nurtality country, would still enable us to keep our armed forces and deter or counter any invasion force to the UK or any overseas British territory.

attributes.action: Publish all registered sex offenders names, addresses and nature of crime.
attributes.background: America allows all law enforcement to publish to the public the names, addresses and crimes committed by all sex offenders.  we as the UK public should be able to have this information to keep our kids safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megan%27s_Law Link to background info on Megan's law this has been running successfully for many years and is proof that it works! The united kingdom public should be informed in order to protect our children if we don't know where they are how can we protect our vulnerable members of society.

attributes.action: Ban weapons using nanotechnology before they are able to be produced
attributes.background: Nanotechnology could be reality in the next few years and, while there are many benefits of this, the potential of nanotech weapons is too great a threat to humanity to be allowed, these weapons must be banned before they can be produced to prevent the devistation that could arise from their use

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to set up sports teams for both genders.
attributes.background:
"Rugby is for boys," "Netball is for girls." 
Gender inequality in sport exists in schools, clubs and at the elite level.
All pupils should be encouraged to take part in any sport.  How hard is it to set up a rugby team for boys and a rugby team for girls? 
You can make a change!

attributes.action: Ban Votes for anyone over the age of 70
attributes.background: In the referendum most young people- 17 or below did not have the chance to decide their future, where old pensioners were allowed to vote and decide our future for us! We want more control for young people!
attributes.additional_details: Such as in the referendum, despite a petetion and growing debate for votes for 16 year olds, the number of old people is on the increase, due to the baby boomers getting older! Therefore to restrict the age this way it would help keep down the number of old people voting and put more decision in the younger generations.

attributes.action: Give employees rights post-probation so they can't be unfairly sacked
attributes.background: I was recently dismissed without my boss following disciplinary procedures. Employees only get job protection after two years, making it easy for SMEs to dismiss staff for unfair reasons. The law needs updating to protect the millions of people employed post probation until they reach two years.
attributes.additional_details:
On the Gov.UK website it states - Before taking any action, your employer should: follow disciplinary procedures or give you a chance to improve 

Small businesses accounted for 99.3% of all private sector businesses at the start of 2015 with 15.6 million people employed by SMEs. After seeking legal advice on the subject ACAS disciplinary procedures only apply after two years. So small businesses do not need to apply these and can unceremoniously make it easy to dismiss staff.

attributes.action: Vehicle tax (Road Fund Licence) per day, not month
attributes.background: Following the changes in vehicle tax, vehicle owners are now forced to surrender the value of the vehicle tax up until the end of the month in which they sell the vehicle.
attributes.additional_details:
Vehicle buyers are also forced to buy a full month, when they will not have had the use of the days preceeding the vehicle purchase.

It is also the case that the computer systems which coordinate the purchase of vehicle tax are given a concentrated workload at the end of each month. This has recently resulted in the service being unavailable.

I propose that vehicle tax should be available daily so that buyers and sellers are not short-changed, and that the systems are more able to cope with a more uniform demand.

This petition is of interest to anyone in the UK who will either buy or sell a motor vehicle.

Please rectify this unfair practice.

attributes.action: Increase Government powers over interest rates to protect savers.
attributes.background: Since 2008 the Bank of England has relentlessly cut interest rates causing savers to lose a considerable amount of income and this has now reached an unacceptable level.  At the moment, the Government has limited power over interest rates.
attributes.additional_details: This petition calls for greater Government powers of the Bank of England's interest rates, so that savers can be protected.

attributes.action: Give the HSE more powers under the law to regulate gas safety for consumers.
attributes.background: A recent Which? investigation showed that engineers failed to provide boiler servicing which is safe and meets minimum requirements for the job. Of the 6 'big companies' and 4 independent companies checked 70% failed to meet minimum legal requirements. The HSE need legal powers to be effective.
attributes.additional_details:
The Health & Safety Executive must be able to hold Gas Safe and it's engineers to account and ensure Gas Safe registered engineers:

1} are competent to complete a full, safe boiler service, with regular checks on performance

2} have a legal minimum boiler service time

3} complete a clear, detailed report

4} are held to account in the same way as other professions which potentially risk peoples lives

5} HSE should complete robust checks on standards of work & update the registration process.

attributes.action: raise issue of election with the Zimbabwean gov &/or the international community
attributes.background: Asking the UK government to help raise the issue about re election in Zimbabwe because there needs to be a strong change in order to reduce poverty, lower unemployment rates, pay civil servants and better the health care

attributes.action: Make the buying age of tobacco products 16+.
attributes.background:
The minimum age was 16 years of prior to 1994. 
Plus we can smoke at 16 but not buy it? this makes no sense and needs to be changed asap.

attributes.action: Drones need unique reg number created by manufacturer which is assigned to buyer
attributes.background:
Problem is there is currently no way of matching a Drone with an owner.

Worse case was a Drone which collided with a British Airway flight over Heathrow. Story covered on 18th April, 2016 - Daily Telegraph
attributes.additional_details:
Daily Telegraph

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2016/04/18/drone-laws-in-the-uk--what-are-the-rules/

BBC

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-35442130

attributes.action: Standardise ID requirements for all public and quasi-public bodies
attributes.background: At present any public authority (or quasi public authority such as a utility company or railway) can randomly select what ID requirements are needed from members of the public to interact with them.  Surely this could be standardised for all such institutions through very simple legislation.
attributes.additional_details: For instance some PAs (eg the Bank of England if you want to exchange old bank notes) will accept a driver's licence as proof over address, others (eg my local authority issuing a parking permit) will only accept a utility bill less than 3 months old and not if it is copied from an on-line bill.   NB this is NOT a request for introduction of compulsory ID cards.

attributes.action: £500 tax allowance,every 4 yrs for sport for either membership fee or equipment.
attributes.background: To capitalize on the excitement of the Olympics, every 4 yrs a £500 tax free allowance per person could be allocated to spend on  either sports membership (golf for an example) or sport equipment. This will prevent certain sports being only available to the well off.

attributes.action: Ask this Government to consider issuing a medal to all serving armed forces.
attributes.background: I consider anyone serving their country for security and safety reasons should be acknowledged by means of a medal of service for their dedication and support to make this a safer and better World for us all to live and work in as a show of appreciation.

attributes.action: Introduce a Mandatory 10 year prison sentence for Vehicle theft/ involvement in.
attributes.background: The people of Great Britain are sick of working hard to buy vehicles, only to have them stolen by criminals who do not care. The impact of their crimes affect thousands of people, who suffer untold hardship, financial loss & emotional distress due to crime. The law needs to be a major deterrent.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the penalty for stealing a vehicle does not fit the crime, many criminals walk free from court with punitive punishments, despite causing huge problems for the victims of their crime.

The law needs to ensure that theft of a vehicle is so harshly punished it will make it unappealing.

attributes.action: Manual workers to retire at 60!!
attributes.background:
We work until we drop!! Is that the idea? Myself and my partner are both manual workers and are 57 years old!! We really can't see ourselves being fit to work until we're 66!! Can you? We're ready to drop now.

Please vote.
attributes.additional_details: Manual workers are more at risk for potential damage to limb and arthritis damage so therefore would cost more in the long run for medical deficiency!! Most of us will end up taking sick leave because we can't manage our jobs. Personally I have worked since I was 14 and am now 57. Is this not long enough!!!

attributes.action: Government to reform the honours system to include posthumous awards
attributes.background: I'm creating this petition to call upon the Government to reform the honours system, so that knighthoods can be awarded posthumously. Its a shame that people that have contributed something for the country but are sadly no longer with us cannot be recognised for their achievements.
attributes.additional_details: A prime example is Bobby Moore. Its now the 50th anniversary of the year of England winning the world cup. He was a leader, a gentleman and credit to this country. Geoff Hurst has been knighted so surely Bobby Moore should be too (posthumously) as he was the Captain of the team, especially in this anniversary year. It would be a very fitting way to celebrate the achievement of the the man and the team.

attributes.action: Create more opportunities to further vocational subject skills in state schools.
attributes.background: In state education here in the U.K our youth have next to no chances to properly further their vocational skills, e.g dance! Many schools not offering a thing in some of these areas that could potentially be the child's gift in life! For many school is the only outlet for them to progress in this.
attributes.additional_details: Focus on sporting and academic departments take away sometimes completely from the vocational or artistic side. If that is a career a youth would want to pursue then it is the EDUCATION systems duty to EDUCATE the students on such matters! But no input or teaching on these skills are taught, hindering the abilities of our youths and holding them back from their potential, MANY, MANY people have a skill in vocational activities and subjects that could lead to a career in it.

attributes.action: Automate all trains so there are no longer drivers or manual door openers.
attributes.background: It is ludicrous in 2016 that huge swathes of the country should be held to ransom by union action over something as silly as who controls the doors - personnel are paid far too much to press a button and move a lever. The technology has existed since the 70s to automate all of this.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 Train Drivers hold the country to ransom whenever they want a pay bump, or even more favourable conditions. The average transport for London driver earns £55k, in the south, the average is £39k. No part of their job requires a human. It's time for progress, guarantee these people jobs until retirement, hire no new drivers - and slowly automate away the skill gap so that the current drivers don't suffer, but that no drivers can come along to make the rest of the country suffer.

attributes.action: Bring university fees down to £4.5 grand a year
attributes.background: People either can't or never pay the money if the government wants their money back they need to bring the fees down

attributes.action: To start the Tax Office and Government standard tax year from the 1st January.
attributes.background: The start date for the Fiscal Year of the 6th April was fixed when the UK moved to the Gregorian Calendar and is based on the antiquated "Quarter Days". Computers and Spreadsheets work best with whole months and years.  It is time that the Government Fiscal year is brought into the 21st century.
